definition: The Peony Pavilion (1598), play by Tang Xianzu 湯顯祖|汤显祖[Tang1 Xian3 zu3]
(of a bird, animal or plant) male/key/hills
red/pellet/powder/cinnabar
pavilion/booth/kiosk/erect

sentences.english: The molding of love in The Peony Pavilion is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 而《牡丹亭》對情的塑形是含混的。

sentences.english: As is known to all, the keynote of the Peony Pavilion is love.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，《牡丹亭》的主旨是寫“情”。

sentences.english: Among his works, Peony Pavilion is the most well-known.
sentences.chinese: 他的戲劇作品中，《牡丹亭》是最廣爲人知的。

sentences.english: In the Peony Pavilion " is a legendary drama with feminist tendency."
sentences.chinese: 名著《牡丹亭》是一部有着女性主義傾向的傳奇作品。

sentences.english: "Passion" is an important topic in the Peony Pavilion, and the soul of it.
sentences.chinese: “情”是《牡丹亭》的一個重要主題，是該劇的靈魂。

sentences.english: Suddenly he heard a rustle in the peony pavilion and someone sighing deeply.
sentences.chinese: 他忽聞有人在牡丹亭畔長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: The original opera is considered a masterpiece of classical Chinese theater.
sentences.chinese: 原作《牡丹亭》被視爲中國經典曲目的代表之作。

sentences.english: The Imperial Granary edition The Peony Pavilion offers a concept of returning to the original state of Kunqu Opera.
sentences.chinese: 皇家糧倉版《牡丹亭》以復歸崑曲肇始狀態的理念。

sentences.english: Suddenly he heard a rustle in the peony pavilion and some sighing deeply.
sentences.chinese: 忽聞有人在牡丹亭畔，長吁短嘆。

definition: Tang Xianzu (1550-1616), Ming poet and dramatist, author of The Peony Pavilion 牡丹亭[Mu3 dan5 Ting2]
Kunqu opera, influential musical theater originating in Kunshan, Jiangsu province in Yuan times
see 崑曲|昆曲[Kun1 qu3]
Romance of the West Chamber by Wang Shifu 王實甫|王实甫[Wang2 Shi2 fu3]
Shaoxing opera
opera highlights performed as independent pieces
Chinese opera
The Peach Blossom Fan, historical play about the last days of the Ming dynasty by Kong Shangren 孔尚任[Kong3 Shang4 ren4]
The Butterfly Lovers, Chinese folktale/abbr. for 梁山伯與祝英台|梁山伯与祝英台[Liang2 Shan1 bo2 yu3 Zhu4 Ying1 tai2]
Tale of the White Snake/Madame White Snake
A Dream of Red Mansions (first completed edition 1791) by Cao Xueqin 曹雪芹[Cao2 Xue3 qin2], one of the four great novels
The Drunken Beauty, Qing Dynasty Beijing opera
Huangmei opera (local opera of Anhui)
see 崑曲|昆曲[Kun1 qu3]
The Butterfly Lovers, Chinese folktale of the tragic love between Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai
pinyin: Liang2 Shan1 bo2 yu3 Zhu4 Ying1 tai2

definition: Huansahji or Washing the Silken Gauze, Yuan and Ming saga reworked by 梁辰魚|梁辰鱼 from History of the Southern States Wu and Yue, 吳越春秋|吴越春秋, a popular opera subject
